word_mean: 缝：用针将丝线、肠线、金属线等穿过组织，通常使伤口边缘对接，但亦用于固定或移动器官或身体其他结构
刺痛：一种剧痛，通常发生在一侧肋缘

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English stice 'a puncture, stabbing pain', of Germanic origin; related to German Stich 'a sting, prick', also to stick. The sense 'loop' (in sewing etc.) arose in Middle English

encyclopedia.content: 简介 星际宝贝2 【作品名称】 Lilo & Stitch 2: Stitch Has a Glitch 【中文翻译】 星际宝贝2：史迪奇有问题 【在美推出】 2005年8月30日 【片长时间】 约68分钟 【作品类别】 迪士尼影音产品首映，长篇剧情动画片 【原著取材】 由迪士尼第41部经典动画【星际宝贝】衍生剧情内容介绍 本片是【星际宝贝】正宗续集，跟之前迪士尼曾推出由【星际宝贝】电视影集引申出的另一部影音产品首映【星际宝贝史迪奇】并不同。本片回归原本

entry.def: If you stitch cloth, you use a needle and thread to join two pieces together or to make a decoration.

example.ex: Fold the fabric and stitch the two layers together...
example.tran: 将布料对折，然后将两层缝在一起。

entry.def: Stitches are the short pieces of thread that have been sewn in a piece of cloth.

example.ex: You can use embroidery stitches for further decoration.
example.tran: 你可以用刺绣来作进一步的装饰。

entry.def: In knitting and crochet, a stitch is a loop made by one turn of wool around a knitting needle or crochet hook.

example.ex: Her mother counted the stitches on her knitting needles...
example.tran: 她母亲数了数编织针上的针数。

entry.def: If you sew or knit something in a particular stitch, you sew or knit in a way that produces a particular pattern.

example.ex: The design can be worked in cross stitch.
example.tran: 这个图案可以用十字针法绣出来。

example.ex: ...a woolly vest knitted in garter stitch.
example.tran: 用平针法编织的羊毛背心

entry.def: When doctors stitch a wound, they use a special needle and thread to sew the skin together.

example.ex: Jill washed and stitched the wound.
example.tran: 吉尔清洗并缝合了伤口。

entry.def: A stitch is a piece of thread that has been used to sew the skin of a wound together.

example.ex: He had six stitches in a head wound.
example.tran: 他头上的伤口缝了 6 针。

entry.tran: (通常指因奔跑或大笑引起的)肋部剧痛，岔气
entry.def: A stitch is a sharp pain in your side, usually caused by running or laughing a lot.
If you are in stitches, you cannot stop laughing.

example.ex: Here's a book that will have you in stitches.
example.tran: 这是一本会让你笑破肚皮的书。

means.word_mean: 1. sewing consisting of a link or loop or knot made by drawing a threaded needle through a fabric
2. a sharp spasm of pain in the side resulting from running

sentences.en: She had the stitches taken out of the wound.
sentences.cn: 她将伤口缝的线拆去了。

jushi.english: She picked her embroidery and started stitching.
jushi.chinese: 她拿起刺绣活开始刺绣。

jushi.english: The tailor stitched the split seam in seconds.
jushi.chinese: 裁缝一会儿工夫就把破缝缝好了。

jushi.english: Mother is stitching a new dress.
jushi.chinese: 妈妈正在缝一件新衣服。
